newsitem.title: CHINA: China recovers $2.62 million from embezzlers.
newsitem.headline: China recovers $2.62 million from embezzlers.

text.p: More than 1,000 people who voluntarily surrendered to police have handed over 21.75 million yuan ($2.62 million) obtained through bribery or graft, the Xinhua news agency said on Wednesday.
Altogether 2,121 people turned themselves in between January and July, of whom 1,157 were suspected of embezzlement or bribery, the agency said. It gave no comparative figures.
Police handled 25,066 cases involving 10,000 yuan ($1,200) or more during the period, up 18.5 percent from the year-ago period, Xinhua said.
The number of senior officials involved in such cases jumped 26.1 percent from last year to 1,404, it said.
Police had paid 817,000 yuan ($98,400) in reward money to 515 vigilant citizens who reported wrongdoing, it added.
China has arrested 160,000 people and executed more than 1,000 since it launched its nationwide "Strike Hard" crackdown on crime.
